sen.j: 麛坂皇子（かごさかのみこ、？ - 神功元年（201年）2月 (旧暦)）は、『古事記』『日本書紀』に伝えられる古墳時代の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kagosaka [(麛坂皇子), Kagosaka no Miko; his date of birth is unknown; he died in February of '201.'] appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) as an Imperial family (royal family) during Kofun period (tumulus period) of Japan.

sen.j: 仲哀天皇の皇子で、母は彦人大兄（景行天皇の皇子）の女・大中姫。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kagosaka was a Prince of the Emperor Chuai, and his (Prince Kagosaka) mother was Onakatsuhime (大中姫) a daughter of Prince Hikohito no Oe [(彦人大兄) 'Prince Hikohito no Oe' was a prince of the Emperor Keiko.]
Imperial Prince Kagosaka was a Prince of the Emperor Chuai, and his mother was Onakatsuhime, a daughter of Prince Hikohito no Oe (Prince Hikohito no Oe was a prince of the Emperor Keiko).
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更、カンマの追加、シングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kagosaka was a Prince of the Emperor Chuai, and his mother was Onakatsuhime, a daughter of Prince Hikohito no Oe (Prince Hikohito no Oe was a prince of the Emperor Keiko).

sen.j: 応神天皇の異母兄に当たる。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kagosaka was the elder paternal half brother of the Emperor Ojin.

sen.j: 『古事記』『日本書紀』によれば、新羅征討中に仲哀天皇が崩御し、神功皇后は応神天皇（後の応神天皇）を産んだ。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" and the "Nihonshoki," the Emperor Chuai met his demise during the Shiragi seito [the Conquest of Silla (an ancient Korean Kingdom;] afterward the Empress Jingu gave birth to the Emperor Ojin (he would become the Emperor Ojin).

According to the "Kojiki" and the "Nihonshoki," the Emperor Chuai met his demise during the Shiragi seito (the Conquest of Silla [an ancient Korean Kingdom]) afterward the Empress Jingu gave birth to the Emperor Ojin (he would become the Emperor Ojin).

sen.j: このことを知った麛坂皇子は次の皇位が幼い皇子に決まることを恐れた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kagosaka's reaction upon receiving word of the death to the Emperor Chuai and to the birth of his baby prince (the Emperor Ojin) was one of dread; he was afraid the child prince would ascend to the throne as the next Emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kagosaka was afraid the child prince would ascend to the throne as the next Emperor when he knew the death of the Emperor Chuai and the birth of his baby prince (the Emperor Ojin).
sen.cmt: 簡略化した文にしました。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kagosaka was afraid the child prince would ascend to the throne as the next Emperor when he knew the death of the Emperor Chuai and the birth of his baby prince (the Emperor Ojin).

sen.j: その為、同母弟の忍熊皇子と共謀し、筑紫国から帰京する皇后らを迎撃しようとした。
sen.e: Thus, Imperial Prince Kagosaka conspired with Imperial Prince Oshikuma (the young brother, each were princes of the Emperor Chuai; and they were birthed by the same mother.); an attack on the Empress Jingu and her baby, during their retuning trip from the Tsukushi Province, was planned.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thus, Imperial Prince Kagosaka conspired with Imperial Prince Oshikuma, a younger maternal half-brother, to attack the Empress Jingu and her baby, during their retuning trip from Tsukushi Province.
sen.cmt: 文の簡略化とthe Tsukushi Province→Tsukushi Provinceに変更しました。
sen.e: Thus, Imperial Prince Kagosaka conspired with Imperial Prince Oshikuma, a younger maternal half-brother, to attack the Empress Jingu and her baby, during their retuning trip from Tsukushi Province.

sen.j: 皇子は播磨国の赤石に陵を築くと偽って陣地を構築し、倉見別（犬上君の祖）・五十狭茅宿禰（いさちのすくね、吉師の祖）に兵を興させた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kagosaka lied when asked of his plans to build the Emperor's (Chuai) tomb in Akashi (County), Harima Province; instead, Prince Kagosaka built up a fortified strong point, then ordered Kuramiwake (ancestor of 'Inukami no kimi') and 'Isachi no Sukune'(ancestor of Kishi) to raise their armies.

On the pretext of building the Emperor's (Chuai) tomb, Imperial Prince Kagosaka created positions in Akashi (County), Harima Province and ordered Kuramiwake (ancestor of Inukami no kimi) and Isachi no Sukune (ancestor of Kishi) to raise their armies.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートを削除して、簡略化した文にしました。
sen.e: On the pretext of building the Emperor's (Chuai) tomb, Imperial Prince Kagosaka created positions in Akashi (County), Harima Province and ordered Kuramiwake (ancestor of Inukami no kimi) and Isachi no Sukune (ancestor of Kishi) to raise their armies.

sen.j: しかし、菟餓野（とがの、大阪市北区 (大阪市)兎我野町か）で反乱の成否を占う祈狩（うけいがり）の最中、イノシシに食い殺されたという。
sen.e: However, at the time when Imperial Prince Kagosaka was engaged in the Ukiegari (this was a hunting quest to foretell the future of ones luck in coming events) hunt to determine his success or failure with the rebellion in Togano [This location is possibly the current place: Togano-Cho, Kita Ward, Osaka City (Osaka City)], he was apparently attacked, then eaten by a wild boar.

However, Imperial Prince Kagosaka was bitten to death by a wild boar during hunting in Togano (this location is possibly the present Togano-Cho, Kita Ward, Osaka City [Osaka City]) for Ukiegari (to predict one's fortune by the game of hunting).
